"What is that you're playing with?" she asked.

was making sauce in his kitchen. Suddenly, his three-year old grandchild burst into the kitchen.
The little one excitedly said: "Grandpa, what are you cooking?" 
Grandpa smiled. He said: "I'm making a special sauce that I enjoy. Would you like to help me?" 
The child got very excited. She said: "Yes, yes, yes!"
So Grandpa and the little girl worked together on the sauce. They chopped the ingredients and stirred the pot, until the sauce smelled delicious. 
Grandpa smiled at the little one and said: "Well done."

The girl held up the shell and it sparkled in the sun. She smiled and waved the shell above her head. Suddenly, her friends clapped and cheered. They had been ignoring her to set up her special surprise!

One day, James was playing in the park with his best friend. As they were running around chasing each other, he saw a tall man standing in the corner. His friend screamed in surprise, but James felt a wave of sadness overtake him. He knew he had seen the man before, but he wasn't sure where.
Then he heard a loud weeping coming from the corner. It was the tall man, and he was crying so much that James dared not approach him. His friend ran away, but James stayed. He watched as the man slowly walked forward, still weeping.
James finally realized

seen it before. He was extremely excited to see what was inside. With an eager look in his eyes, he quickly opened the door.
The refrigerator was filled with all sorts of food and drinks! Bob was so happy he cheered out loud. 
"Oh wow!" Bob said, with a big smile on his face. 
He reached his hands inside the refrigerator and grabbed a big orange. He held tight and ran outside. 
Once outside, Bob quickly covered the orange with dirt. 
"I'm going to save this for later," Bob said, still enthusiastic about his new discovery.

The boys were excited and started to take the things out. Suddenly, a man appeared behind them. He was very angry and yelled at the boys. He told them that the box belonged to his shop and that they had to put everything back. 
The boys tried to explain that they were only curious and wanted to support the shop but the man did not listen. He simply took the box away and told them to stay away from the shop.
The boys felt sad and scared and quickly ran back to their room. From that day, they realised the importance of asking for help and support before doing anything.

Daddy looked at the page he was holding. It said something about having a spicy dinner. He laughed and turned to the three year old sitting beside him. 
"What do you see?" he asked her.
The girl looked at the page and smiled. "Spicy!" she said. Daddy laughed and handed the page over to her.
The little girl studied the page first with her eyes, then her hands. She ran her fingers over the letters as she examined the words.
She squinted her eyes as she curiously asked Daddy what it meant. He smiled and explained that

it was Santa Claus," one of them said.
Jimmy flew up to take a closer look, and sure enough the feather had his name written on it! He was so excited that he quickly flew back down and showed his friends.
"See, it says my name!" he shouted with a big smile on his face.
His friends were so happy for him that some of them even started to dance. They all agreed that it was the funniest thing they had ever seen. 
From then on, Jimmy and his friends often hung out around the tree with the feather, and they had lots of fun.

One day, a big cat and a little mouse were in the woods. The big cat wanted to scare the little mouse. The big cat said, "Boo!" The little mouse jumped and felt uncomfortable. The little mouse did not like the big cat.
The little mouse said, "Please, do not scare me. I am only one year old." The big cat laughed and said, "Okay, little mouse. I will not scare you anymore."

Suddenly, an old man appears from behind a tree. He said, “Don’t worry! This diamond can serve a special purpose. It can help us find something very unusual!”
The two friends were amazed! They asked how they could use the diamond and the old man told them it was simple. They just had to hold it up in the air and spin in circles. 
The two friends followed the instructions and, sure enough, they soon found a hidden cave. Louis and Zoe couldn't wait to find out what was inside!
